Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Scharnhorst, can't you hear that? Your crew needs you!
You're still carrying on with that? Shouldn't you be getting prepared for battle, Kap?
I just figured you'd want to know about the danger your beloved crew is in. You need to rush to their aid!
Ugh, if you keep on like this, I'm just going to wait until the Morganas take care of you all. Then I'll come in to clean up the mess.

Fields.MenuText: Yo–you're kidding, right?
You must have a poor opinion of us if you don't think we can handle a few Morganas on our own.
You wouldn't do that. You love us too much!

Fields.DialogueText: I encourage you to try me and find out.
My opinion of you all can't get much worse, don't forget that!
I do not! Stop saying that!
Well, I—
Shut it! Don't open your mouth and say anything to change my mind. We've got Morganas to deal with.
...She wouldn't let us all get killed just because I'm teasing her, right?
Maybe I should play it safe this time around...
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, I was informed of something I found intriguing.
Oh, did you hear about the changes I made to the mess hall menu? I thought marzipan was a more enticing dessert option.
You did what? Marzipan?
You're not a fan? They're going to be in the shape of little pigs. They'll be adorable, you'll love it.
That's not what I'm talking about, I was just informed that our radar system came with strings attached.
Oh, that. Yes, I've been meaning to mention that to you.
I understand how it might've slipped your mind. You've been sooo busy changing the dessert menu.
It's not that big a deal. They want us to utilize what they installed. You're not angry, are you?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, I am. You should've looped me in before making a decision like this.
Honestly, I'm more disappointed than anything else.
No. Just tell me next time, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Loop you in? Do you expect me to check in with you before everything I do?
Disappointed? You kind of sound like a mom right now, Kap. Are you going to ground me next?
I can't make any promises, but I can try.
*ALARM*
Well, duty calls, Kapitän. We can talk more about this later.
We haven't even—
Gone into...details. I'll find her later. She's not going to get away from me that easily.
@BATTLE
Yeah. I do.
So there've been reports of Morganas that don't show up on ordinary equipment?
That's right, Kapitän, and I didn't even have to repeat myself.
You don't have to be patronizing.
We both know that isn't true.
Anyway, we're expected to use the new radar of ours to take down these "invisible" Morganas, right?
Yes, I didn't think it was too much to ask for, so I said sure.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like a lot of trouble to me.
It could be worse, I guess.
What happens when they eventually adapt to this new equipment and become invisible again?

Fields.DialogueText: Fighting an enemy that thinks they're invisible? Sounds more like fun to me.
We could be dealing with these Morganas without the shiny new radar. You're welcome.
Then we'll get a newer radar and the cycle will begin anew. It's how these things work, Kap.
You went through an awful lot of trouble to get this radar and now we've been roped into this affair. Was it still worth it?
Obviously. Did you forget why we needed it in the first place? The last thing anyone on this ship needs, especially me, is to be caught flat-footed.
You don't deal very well with surprises, do you?
Nope. Just ask the last person to throw me a birthday party.
I'll definitely keep that in mind.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, the assignment you got us roped into is begging for your attention.
Huh? What's going on?
Apparently, a port in Japan's been having issues with Morganas striking without warning. We're being sent to deal with the issue.
Japan, huh? We've got quite a distance to go then. We better get booking.
Getting sent off to Japan at a moment's notice doesn't bother you?
I've been expecting it. The INPF is a worldwide thing after all. Are you worried about dealing with other nations?

Fields.MenuText: That's not it. I wasn't sure how you felt about the rest of the world.
A little. Tensions are plenty high.
I'm no fan of politics.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh, I'm not particularly fond of the Japanese, or the Americans, or the Brits, but I don't have any problems with them, yet. That is to say, they haven't pissed me off.
No need to worry, Kapitän. If the tension breaks, you can count on me to find a way to victory for you.
I'll do the talking then. I'm not just a genius on the battlefield. Besides, people love me.
Okay then, no time to waste. Let's resupply and head to the Orient.
*ALARM*
After we deal with that.
It shouldn't take long.
@BATTLE
Kap, you see that on the horizon?
On the horizon you say? Let's see—huh? Scharnhorst, give me back my binoculars.
I wouldn't take 'em so often if you kept an eye on them.
So what am I looking at? Even with my binoculars I can barely make it out. Is it a rock outcropping?
It's a capsized ship. I'm thinking they ran into Morganas, or pirates.
Pirates?
Mhmmm... Though they'd just as likely take the ship as their own. Either way, if we're quick we could hurry in and salvage what we can before the ship's at the bottom of the ocean.
That's what you're concerned with right now?
Always. What are you concerned with?

Fields.MenuText: How about rescuing any survivors?
How about keeping an eye out for any nearby Morganas?
Well, I can't say a salvage attempt wouldn't be unwarranted.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, we can do that too. We can save people and valuables. It's called multitasking.
I assumed that was unsaid. I'm not just going to dive into a situation like that with my eyes closed.
That's what I like to hear. Why let all those valuables waste into the waves?
All right, let's go in and see what we can do.
And find! I feel like a kid on Christmas morning, and that ship is my tannenbaum filled with presents.
Scharnhorst, you're drooling.
Sorry, that happens when I fantasize sometimes.
@BATTLE
Morganas dead ahead!
@BATTLE
Okay, so Morganas attacked, but we still got one hell of a score out of that wreck. Right, Kapitän?
Don't forget the survivors we rescued.
Yeah, but look at all this stuff!
I think you might've missed your calling Scharnhorst. You're more of a pirate than a military officer.
I'll take that as a compliment. Though the two can be similar.

Fields.MenuText: I see the two as polar opposites.
Well, maybe corrupt officers are like pirates.
Too true!

Fields.DialogueText: Polar opposites? The world isn't black and white.
Not just corrupt. Men and women doing their jobs can look a lot like villains from an outside perspective.
I could talk about pirates all day!
Before all this insanity happened with the Morganas, our original assignment was going to be to disrupt Britain's merchant trade.
Our?
Me and my sis. It's not important. What I'm trying to say is that something like that seems more like something a pirate might do, right?
Well, that's different. It's war.
It might be different, but it's also similar. You might think I'm a bit of a pirate, but sometimes that's what you need in an officer.
I didn't mean it as an insult.
I'd hope not, otherwise I'd have to send you to walk the plank.
Your jokes are perhaps worse than mine.
You wanted to see me, Kaptäin?
So you and your sister are close, huh?
What is this? Why are you asking about my sister all of a sudden?

Fields.MenuText: I'm trying to get to know you a little better.
You could say I'm...gathering intel.

Fields.DialogueText: You're trying to get to know me by asking about my sister? Seems like a roundabout tactic, if you ask me.
You should keep to gathering intel on the enemy. Unless...you see me as an enemy.
If you really must know, Gneisenau, my sister, has always been... Well, she's never been... How do I say this?
Take your time, I've got all day. It's not like I'm a busy captain of a battleship.
She's never been a lot of fun. She's always cared way too much about honor, and she loves to be in the thick of battle.
I'm of the opinion that morals and honor can't get you so much as a loaf of bread. As for combat, I'd much rather be pulling the strings than taking the shots.
You two certainly seem different. I take it you're not on the best of terms.
What do you mean? Just because we don't agree on anything doesn't mean I don't love her. For all our differences, we're still sisters.
I'm glad you two are close, and being different is often a good thing.
Unless you are a Morgana...
@BATTLE
You can be a little intense sometimes, but you're far from an enemy.
Hmmm, Japan is bigger than I was expecting.
What were you expecting?
I don't know...maps make it look so puny.
We can make time for sightseeing later. We should keep our eyes open for any of these "invisible" Morganas on our way into port.
Actually, we've been picking something up for a little bit. It's been following us. I'm sure it thinks we can't see it.
We've had Morganas tailing us, and you didn't tell me? For how long?
Well, I wasn't sure if it was our target or not. I had to be positive before we blew it out of the water.

Fields.MenuText: Being your captain is never easy.
Just tell me next time, Scharnhorst, or I swear, I'll...
I have to say, nice thinking, Scharnhorst.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, I know, right?
You'll do what? Turn us around and head home? Face it, Kap, we know who has all the real power on this ship.
Hmmm, a rare compliment. Keep 'em coming, Kaptäin.
All right, we've got some more Morgana friends joining the party. They'll strike soon. What do you say we beat them to the punch?
Sounds like a plan to me.
@BATTLE
That was all of them, right?
Mhmmmm... Yeah, sure.
We might want to stay in the area for a little while, just to make sure we got them all.
Mhmmmm... Yeah, sure.
We should start eating all our meals on the toilet to save time.
Mhmmmm... Yeah, sure.
Okay, what are you doing over there, Scharnhorst? Are those dice?
Oh, Kapitän, how long have you been there?
I was just... Not long at all. What are you up to?
Being in Japan reminded me of this game a Japanese Belle told me about. She was infatuated with all kinds of games, and she told me about a few different gambling ones.
I think this one was...Cho-Han... Yeah, that sounds right.
It looks like you're just rolling dice in a cup.
Well, it's hard to gamble with myself. Oh, I know, you wanna play a round or two? It's super simple.

Fields.MenuText: I've seen you gamble, no thanks.
Sounds fun. Just no cheating.
How do you play?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come on. This is a totally different game. You'll be fine.
Scout's honor.
You roll a pair of dice in the cup, and bet on if the sum comes out even or odd. Simple, right?
Okay, I think I can fit in a game or two.
*ALARM*
No take backs!
We can play after the fight.
I get it, Morganas always gotta come first. Attention hogs.
@BATTLE
I can see you crossing your fingers.
So?
You were never a scout were you?
Heheheh, come on, just play.
This is a welcome break from all the Morgana attacks...
*DICE ROLLING*
All right, let's play one more game. Odds or evens?

Fields.MenuText: Hmmm... Let's go with odds this time.
I'm feeling like evens.
Ladies first.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you can be pretty odd sometimes.
Evens it is. Good luck.
Then I pick evens. You'll be odds.
*DICE ROLLING*
Six and three. Odds.

Fields.MenuText: Hey, another win for me!
Shoot, What are the odds, huh?
I owe this victory to you.

Fields.DialogueText: Dammit! I thought I had gotten it this time.
Dammit! I thought I had gotten it this time.
Dammit! I thought I had gotten it this time.
Why are you so angry? It's just a game.
It was supposed to land on evens. I thought for sure I'd figured out the trick.
Trick? Are you trying to cheat, Scharnhorst?
It's like you don't know me at all.
Dice games are a lot harder to cheat with. I can't hide dice up my sleeve. Well, I can, but I don't see how that could help in this situation.
Mhmmmm. Well, if anyone can figure it out, it's you. However, I think I'm done playing for the day.
You just don't want me to kick your butt when I figure out how to do it.
There's that, but you're out of money.
What? How long have we been playing this?
Too long. I've got captaining to do.
Wait, Kapitän! One more game! All or nothing!
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol off the port midship!
@BATTLE
Excellent work, Scharnhorst. If it wasn't for us, those Morganas would've taken that vessel.
Yeah, I guess we saved them.
What's with the attitude? You look disappointed.
You might enjoy being a hero, but that's not my idea of a good time, Kap.
What would you rather we have done?
Ideally we could've done like the Vitalienbrüder do. Captured the ship and start ourselves a little armada.
These Vitalienbrüder sound an awful lot like pirates.
You say that like there's something wrong with pirates.

Fields.MenuText: We're not pirates, Scharnhorst.
Maybe we'll try that next time, Scharnhorst, if you think that's such a good idea.
You'd have killed all those people aboard that ship, Scharnhorst?

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know. You don't have to keep reminding me.
Ha, really? I was half-joking, Kapitän. I never expected you to actually go for it.
No, I'm not a senseless murderer. If I really wanted the ship, I'd just wait for the Morganas to finish off the crew, then I'd swoop in to save the vessel. Easy as that.
Don't worry, Kapitän. I know that ship wouldn't be of much use to us. It's not like it has a Belle. It wouldn't last long against any Morganas without one.
Every once in a while I can't help but think about what Klaus Störtebeker would do.
I take it he was the leader of these pirates?
One of them. How can you not know who he was? He's got to be one of Germany's most famous pirates.
I don't spend nearly as much time thinking about pirates as you do, clearly.
If you ever want to change that, you know where to find me.
So, this Störtebeker guy, what's great about him?
Hmmm? What did you just ask me, Kapitän? Are you talking to me about pirates right now? Did you get hooked? Is this the start of a fanclub?
I'm trying to figure out why you're so fascinated by them.
I guess I can fill you in a little. Störtebeker isn't even his real last name.
What's his real name then?
Lost in time. Isn't that mesmerizing? Pirates always take awesome nom de guerres like that.
Störtebeker translates to "empty the mug with one gulp." He could probably drink you under the table.
Hmmm, that is enthralling.
I'm glad you agree. Hey, if you were a pirate, what do you think your name would be?

Fields.MenuText: Captain Kills-a-lot! To strike fear in my enemies.
Captain. Why bother changing it?
Captain...Ceiling? I'm not good at this game.

Fields.DialogueText: A little on the nose, but I like the energy!
That's just boring. Maybe that can be your name. Kapitän Boring.
That's okay, we can work on your pirate name later.
*ALARM*
Hey, there's my pirate name.
Captain Interrupting Alarm?
Kapitän Morgana Verdammnis. The last thing a Morgana sees.
Very impressive sounding name. Now, let's see you earn it.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, it's time to get moving again.
Another invisible Morgana? It's about time! This area has been clear of them for a while now.
Let's hope we can do as good of a job for the UK.
They're sending us that far away? There's nothing closer?

Fields.MenuText: Trust me, I asked them. They said anything closer was already being investigated.
Don't complain. You signed us up for this job.
It could be worse.

Fields.DialogueText: Investigated? Is that the polite way of saying destroyed?
I'm not complaining. I phrased my words very carefully to not complain.
Yeah, I know there are locations further than the UK. That doesn't make it a bright side.
We must be the closest available ship.
I guess you're right. We better get going then. I hope they're not already gone by the time we get there.
@BATTLE
You're still rolling those dice? Haven't figured out how to cheat yet?
Wouldn't you like to know.

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I'd prefer not to, as long as you don't get in trouble.
I'm a little invested at this point.
Yeah, I would. You're not the only one who could use some ill-gotten gains.

Fields.DialogueText: I won't get in any trouble, as long as I don't get caught.
Invested? Hmmm, are you more worried about my success or failure?
Oh, now who's acting like a pirate? I like it, Kap.
How about one more game while we have the time?
So you promise no cheating?
It's not cheating if you don't get caught.
*ALARM*
Either way, it looks like we've got more important things to do.
Yeah, yeah, but afterwards we've got a game to play.
@BATTLE
Let's test our luck with this roll!
You win again.
I know, right? But I'm sure I won't win the next game. Let's bet higher!

Fields.MenuText: Scharnhorst, you're cheating, and you're being obvious about it at this point.
Wow, you're really lucky today, Scharnhorst. I might have to call it quits.
Okay, let's double the usual bet.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it's not like I'm too worried about how you'll react. You're not gonna start throwing punches.
Luck has nothing to do with it. It's all skill.
Seriously? You're not this gullible, Kapitän. Stop acting weird.
Aren't you going to ask how I'm doing it?
Well, I'd assume loaded dice, but we've switched them a few times.
Please, it's nothing that pedestrian.
Are you going to tell me, or leave me guessing?
Hmmm...I haven't decided yet. It's kind of fun to leave you floundering.
Hate to disappoint, but I don't have to flounder. I can just stop playing games with you.
Oh, that's no fun!
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. Morganas, just in time.
Wait, you're not seriously gonna stop playing with me, right?
We've got more important things to worry about.
@BATTLE
Bang. That's three down.
We're getting closer to UK waters.
I know—Kapow. That's four.
Why are you pretending to shoot at passing ships?
Well, you won't gamble with me anymore, so I found another way to pass the time.
It'd be so easy to overpower and outmaneuver any one of those merchant vessels. Sometimes it's fun to play the battle in my head.
That's what you're doing when you're finger shooting at them?
They're pretty quick battles. They don't put up much of a fight.
Still got that piratical mind of yours, huh?
Until the day I die.
How did...Störtebeker die?
Hmmm? Well, there are a lot of stories, but my favorite talks about how he was betrayed by a member of his crew. They disabled the ship just as a fleet caught them in a trap.
So a whole fleet was put together to capture him? Then his own crew ended up turning on him?
One member of his crew.
If we did go after all those ships you're pretending to take pot shots at, that would inevitably happen to us.
Your point being?

Fields.MenuText: Nevermind, you wouldn't listen to me anyway.
Pirates have the world turned against them, you have the majority of the world on your side.
Your crew trusts and cares about you, and I'm not sure that would be the case if you went out killing innocents and stealing ships.

Fields.DialogueText: So you went on that tangent for nothing?
Maybe as long as I'm fighting Morganas. There is still a war going on, Kapitän.
I'd like to think that my crew would follow me through any storm. If they didn't, there's always the brig.
I do get your point though, Kapitän. There's a reason that all pirates inevitably end up on the sharp end of an executioner's axe.
I just don't want that for you.
You and me both!
@BATTLE
Look at that, Scharnhorst. We're nearing port.
Yeah, it looks really nice, but does it really have to rain so damn much here?
That explains the umbrella. I take it you're not a fan of the weather?
I'm not a fan of getting wet, and I don't need you pointing out the irony.

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't dream of it.
Irony? What irony?
How can I ignore it? It's far too ridiculous!

Fields.DialogueText: Of course you wouldn't. You're smarter than that, aren't you.
You know, the irony of a Belle hating to get wet. I'm a ship...surrounded by water.
Okay, keep it up and I am going to punch you. You only get one warning.
You don't need to be afraid of the rain. It's not bad right now. In fact, it's kind of nice. Almost looks like it'll clear up soon.
I'm not scared! I just don't like it. It makes me feel...slimy and icky.
What about bathing?
That's different!
*ALARM*
Well, whether it clears up or stays rainy, we've got Morganas.
@BATTLE
Morganas approaching from the Irish Sea!
@BATTLE
One got away, but we're following after it. It's moving faster than we thought, though. We might lose it at this rate.
Oh, it won't get too far. There aren't many places it can hide. I've studied these waters. I know how to catch my prey.
Glad to hear you're so confident in British waters.
Yeah, did you forget? I was supposed to be in these waters destroying the British trade ships. If I weren't hunting Morganas down, I'd be here hunting merchant vessels.
That's right, you and your sister. I guess you're using your powers for the good of the world now.
I was going to use them for good before—the good of Germany.
It's a little ironic that I'm here to help now. Never imagined I'd be sailing British waters without British ships in my sights.

Fields.MenuText: Well, they were in your sights. They were just pretend sights on the way here.
Let me guess, you still feel the urge, right?
Personally, I prefer fighting Morganas. I'd rather fight monsters than men.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, but no one got hurt or anything. That's half the real fun.
A little, but honestly, I'm good where I am.
The Morganas are a more worthy challenge. Though there's not nearly enough to loot from our victories.
Uh, Captain, the sub seems to have disappeared.
What?! Where'd it go? Find it before I throw you overboard!
Calm down, Scharnhorst. It disappeared. It's what these things do.
I'll find it. Though it might take longer now.
Dammit, I lost again!
Lady Luck just isn't on your side today.
I guess not. I think I'm done. It was fun though, Scharnhorst.
Yeah, It's always a pleasure to take your money. Do I have any other takers?
When I said I wasn't going to play with you any more, I didn't mean you should start hustling the crew.
Oh, relax, We're just playing for peanuts. Got time for a game, Kapitän?
Maybe, but only if we use my own dice.
Well, why would you want to do that? We could just use some of mine. They're much better.
I've figured out your game, Scharnhorst.

Fields.MenuText: All of your dice are loaded, and you've memorized what they'll all land on.
You're using magnets to manipulate where your metallic dice will land.
You're using some kind of Belle trickery. A lesser captain would call it magic.

Fields.DialogueText: I think you have a pretty high opinion of me if you think my memory is that good.
Magnets? That seems like a pretty long winded way to cheat.
You think I'm winning by...magic? I think you had a little too much to drink with lunch.
Captain, Scharnhorst, we're picking up the signal of that runaway Morgana. Should we give chase?
Obviously! We're not letting it get away again.
Yes, ma'am.
Are you sure, Scharnhorst? We could be getting lured into a trap.
Trap or not, I'm not letting it get away again. I refuse to let some measly Morgana best me.
We'll have to finish this game later. But I'll tell you this much, you were close.
@BATTLE
Time to be the cat to that Morgana's mouse!
@BATTLE
That was quite the battle. You ever worry in the middle of it?
No. I wasn't planning on dying here.
You sound confident. Have you already planned how you're going to die?
Not the specifics, but I know it'll be a massive battle. My sister and I fighting back to back as we struggle against insurmountable odds, until the waves finally overtake us together.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like a good way to go.
Sounds depressing, if you ask me.
Doesn't sound like you at all. I can't imagine you taking it like that.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you think so, since you'd go down with me.
Death is depressing. There's no good way to go, but going with my sister would be better than going alone.
I wouldn't go quietly. We'd be sure to take as many of them with us as we could.
No matter what, I refuse to die without my sister, and a thousand guns aimed at us.
Until then, let's make sure we stay afloat. I'll get a status report on all systems before more Morganas show up.
I'm with you there. I'm in no hurry to die. I don't have a death wish.
You know, all the talk of death reminded me of something fascinating.
Something interesting, huh? Do tell.
The most famous story about Klaus Störtebeker is about his execution.
His execution? Great, as if this death talk wasn't dark enough.
Oh, relax. It's a great story!
He and his companions were all lined up to get the axe, so he made an unorthodox deal with the official overseeing his execution.
However many of his companions that he could walk past after getting beheaded would be released.
Really? That's mesmerizing. How far did he get?
According to the legend, he made it past twelve of his men before his headless body was tripped by the executioner.
Twelve? Without a head?
Yeah, and he probably would've got even further if the executioner hadn't tripped him.
Did the twelve men go free?
What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I think it's an enthralling story, but I don't believe a word of it.
I think I now have one less reason to trust government officials.
I wish I could've been there to see it. It must've been quite a show.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it might've been a little embellished over the years, but I believe it.
I know! They should've gone free, but they all faced the axe together.
Right? Though, if I was there back then, I would have tried a gallant rescue.
You know, if we ever face the axe, I'm sure I could walk my headless body past you to save your life.
I suppose I should take that as a compliment?
Well, you better. I wouldn't push myself past death like that for just anyone.
Well, thank you, Scharnhorst. I'd like to say I'd do the same.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, I can't help but notice we don't seem welcome in port.
Oh, really? I hadn't noticed. You know, we are still at war. It makes sense that they'd be scared of me.
I suppose you're right, I guess it'd be for the best if we just did our business and got out of here as quickly as possible.
There's no rush, it's not like I don't understand their spiteful glares. If things were just a little different, they'd be running from me, screaming for their lives.

Fields.MenuText: And that doesn't bother you?
When I see those dirty scowls on their faces, I kind of wish they were running and screaming.
They wouldn't if they got to know you; you're just a big softie.

Fields.DialogueText: They're not even pawns on the chessboard. Their personal opinion of me doesn't matter in this war we're fighting.
No reason to hold grudges on the populace. Though I appreciate the sentiment.
Don't call me that! I'm not a softie. I'll toss you in the ocean without a second thought.
Captain, we should be ready to leave port soon.
Excellent, thank you.
Sir.
Good news. We can leave and start out to wherever our next assignment is.
Right, our next assignment. More invisible Morganas...yay.
Don't forget, you signed us up for this.
I know.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, have we gotten any new reports on "invisible" Morganas? We still don't have a heading.
Nope, it's been unusually quiet. Maybe we should head back to Germany.

Fields.MenuText: Hmmm, that's odd, maybe we should contact them.
Maybe we already exterminated all of them like weeds.
That doesn't sound like the worst idea. It'd be a less tense place to wait, for sure.

Fields.DialogueText: No, I'm not sure that's a good idea. They'll get to us when they get to us, or they won't.
Well, I wouldn't be surprised. There haven't been all that many of them to start with.
Yeah, and while we can wait, we can find something else to do. No reason to sit on our hands, you know?
I'm sure they're all busy with their work. There's no reason to rush them.
There's a bit of a reason. The Morganas are threatening the world.
All the more reason to go out and fight them. We don't have to wait for a new report to blow up some Morganas.
Hell, for all we know, we'll never get another mission to hunt "invisible" Morganas again.
Hmmm...you're acting a little off, Scharnhorst.
*ALARM*
Oh, you hear that? We might not be getting reports, but we're still fighting Morganas. Let's go, Kap.
I think it's time to talk to our contacts.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, do you have something to tell me?
That depends. Do you think I should tell you something?
I know you reported our radar destroyed. That's why we haven't gotten our next assignment. You've got some explaining to do.
Oh, is it not destroyed? Well, golly gee, I guess I was mistaken.
You couldn't be any less convincing. Talk to me, Scharnhorst.
Fine. I got sick of running all over the place for those guys. It started getting boring. So, I made a calculated risk and decided to fib a little.

Fields.MenuText: In other words, you lied because you were bored.
If you were that bored, you could've just told me.
Boring? Did you forget almost dying?

Fields.DialogueText: It sounds a lot worse when you put it like that.
I signed us up for the job, so I figured it was up to me to get us out of it.
There's nothing exciting about almost dying. You're being dramatic, we weren't anywhere close to it.
I understand you want a new assignment, but if anyone finds out that our radar isn't broken, it's going to be bad news.
They won't find out. Who's going to come looking?
I'm thinking January Abbot and her team might like to come and repair, or at least reclaim whatever might be left.
I suppose that could happen.
If we come clean now, I doubt they'd look favorably upon us. They might take the whole system back and refuse to work with us in the future.
Another good point. I...dug us a hole didn't I?
It's okay, I've got a plan. You're not going to like it though.
@BATTLE
*BANG*
I hate you, Kapitän. This was so expensive!
*CRASH*
We might as well just be shredding money!
*CRACK*
Eeeeeek!
Now this is a good work out.
You're a monster. I bet you enjoy giving to charity too.
Stop scowling, Scharnhorst. Here, take a swing.
I...but it cost us so much money...
If it's not smashed to pieces, it'll cost us more than money.
Ugh, fine, give me the stupid hammer.
*SMASH*

Fields.MenuText: Atta girl, smash that priceless piece of cutting edge technology!
Is that all you've got? I had a feeling you were all bark and no bite.
Feels good, right? Take another swing!

Fields.DialogueText: Stop reminding me how expensive it was!
Oh, you want bite? Watch your mouth. I can easily swing this thing into your head.
It doesn't feel good at all!
Congrats, Scharnhorst. We're officially partners in crime.
I guess you're right. If anyone else asks, the radar was destroyed by Morganas.
Exactly. Not by a captain, a Belle, and a hammer.
*SWING*
This is starting to feel better. It's getting fun now.
Well, with every hit, it depreciates in value.
That must be it. You wanna take a few more hits?
*ALARM*
Oh, dang. The downside of not having working radar. We'll have to pick up a new one when we get to port.
After the battle, we'll be shocked to find everything in pieces! If no one looks too deeply into it, we should be good.
We'll be great. We always are when we work as a team.
Hmm... Yeah, we're pretty good. Now come on, let's take care of business.
@BATTLE
*BANG*
*CRASH*
*CRACK*
Except, it kind of does. It's weird.
What? It's done.
I just hope you don't expect me to clean this up.
